results.name: a(1) = 1, a(2) = -1, a(3) = 2; for n > 3, a(n) = -(2*n-5)*a(n-1).
comment: Sequence is also the first column of the inverse of the infinite lower triangular matrix M, where M(j,k) = 1+2*(k-1)*(j-k) for k < j, M(j,k) = 1 for k = j, M(j,k) = 0 for k > j.
Upper left 6 X 6 submatrix of M is
and upper left 6 X 6 submatrix of M^-1 is
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..400
formula: G.f.: 1 + x  - x*W(0) , where W(k) = 1 + 1/( 1 - x*(2*k+1)/( x*(2*k+1) - 1/W(k+1) )); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Aug 22 2013
program: (PARI) {m=19; print1(1, ",", -1, ","); print1(a=2, ","); for(n=4, m, k=-(2*n-5)*a; print1(k, ","); a=k)} \\ _Klaus Brockhaus_, May 21 2007
(PARI) {m=19; M=matrix(m, m, j, k, if(k>j, 0, if(k==j, 1, 1+2*(k-1)*(j-k)))); print((M^-1)[, 1]~)} \\ _Klaus Brockhaus_, May 21 2007
(MAGMA) m:=19; M:=Matrix(IntegerRing(), m, m, [< j, k, Maximum(0, 1+2*(k-1)*(j-k)) > : j, k in [1..m] ] ); Transpose(ColumnSubmatrix(M^-1, 1, 1)); \\ _Klaus Brockhaus_, May 21 2007
(GAP) F:=Factorial;; Concatenation([1,-1], List([3..25], n-> (-1)^(n+1)*F(2*n-5)/(2^(n-4)*F(n-3)) )); # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 25 2019
